feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Lohnbearbeitung - Auslaufsteuerung
entry.content:
Hallo zusammen, ich bin auf folgende SAP Note gestoßen: https://me.sap.com/notes/43636/D.

Die Note beschreibt folgendes: Keine Umleitung der Bereitstellungsbedarfe für Lohnbearbeitung. Bereitstellungsbedarf wird nicht auf das Nachfolgematerial umgeleitet. Bedarf nach dem Auslaufdatum, der nicht gedeckt ist, wird in der Dispoliste mit der Ausnahmemeldung 58 'Ungedeckter Bedarf jenseits Auslaufdatum' gekennzeichnet. Eine Bedarfsdeckung durch neue Bestellvorschläge findet nicht statt.

Grund: Es wird nicht zwischen 'Lohnbearbeiter-Sekundärbedarf' (für Planauftrag, Bestellanforderung) und 'Lohnbearbeiter-Reservierung' (für LB-Bestellung) unterschieden.

Hatte jemand schon das selbe Szenario in einem Projekt bzw. kennt eine Lösung wie man dies Elegant lösen kann?

entry.title: Custom Report in Project System
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are planning costs on the WBS using unit cost method. The planned costs on a WBS is sum of planned costs for various item categories, obtained using simple multiplication of price and quantity. The costs will be planned in different versions. My client requires a report that compares the price, quantity, value of each item category in different versions for a particular WBS element or for the whole project (but WBS element wise). I am trying to prepare the functional specification of the report for ABAP development. CONSIDER A SITUATION WHERE BUDGET IS NOT PLANNED. I started by passing the project definition in PSPHI table of PRPS table and passing the WBS element in POSID field of the same table. I obtained OBJNR from this. I then passed OBJNR in RPSCO table along with the version in VERSN and obtained the details on planned costs with WRTTP for planned values. I am now unable to understand the link between RPSCO and CKHS table. If I pass OBJNR directly in CKHS, I am able to obtain KALNR. This KALNR is further passed in CKIS table to get the item category wise detail, i.e., price, quantity and value corresponding to each item category. Can you please guide me to establish a link between RPSCO and CKHS table? This link is necessary to pull the version in. If budget is planned, I can directly see BPGE table for VERSN and obtain KALNR and then pass KALNR in CKIS table to obtain the details at the level of item category. Will this still be the solution in cases of no budgets? Thanks

entry.title: CDS View - Casting to Data Element but Field Name is Missing in SE16N
entry.content:
Hello,

Edit: I have changed the language to English as suggested for better understanding but to my surprise now it's working!
I don't know what the problem was but I will drop the whole code here just in case.

The CDS:

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Alış Faturaları'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
    serviceQuality: #X,
    sizeCategory: #S,
    dataClass: #MIXED
}
define view entity ZMM_DDL_PUR_INV
  as select from    rseg
    inner join      rbkp   on  rbkp.belnr = rseg.belnr
                           and rbkp.gjahr = rseg.gjahr
    left outer join but000 on but000.partner = rbkp.lifnr
    left outer join mara   on rseg.matnr = mara.matnr
    left outer join t023t  on  t023t.matkl = mara.matkl
                           and t023t.spras = $session.system_language
    left outer join t134t  on  t134t.mtart = mara.mtart
                           and t134t.spras = $session.system_language
    inner join      a003   on  a003.mwskz = rseg.mwskz
                           and a003.kappl = 'TX'
                           and a003.aland = 'TR'
                           and a003.kschl = 'MWVS'
    inner join      konp   on konp.knumh = a003.knumh
{
  key rbkp.bukrs,
  key rbkp.blart,
  key rbkp.belnr,
  key rseg.buzei,
      rseg.shkzg,
      rbkp.xblnr,
      rbkp.budat,
      rbkp.lifnr,
      but000.name_org1,
      rseg.ebeln,
      rseg.ebelp,
      mara.mtart,
      t134t.mtbez,
      mara.matkl,
      t023t.wgbez,
      rseg.matnr,
      @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'bstme'
      rseg.menge,
      rseg.bstme,
      @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'waers'
      cast(
       cast(
         case when rseg.menge <> 0 then cast(rseg.wrbtr as abap.dec(11,2)) / cast(rseg.menge as abap.dec(11,2)) else 0 end
       as abap.dec(11,4))
      as zfi_e_birim_fiyat) as birim_fiyat,
      @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'waers'
      rseg.wrbtr,
      @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'waers'
      cast(
        cast(
          case when konp.kbetr <> 0 then (cast(rseg.wrbtr as abap.dec(11,4)) * cast(konp.kbetr as abap.dec(11,4))) / cast(1000 as abap.dec(11,4)) else 0 end
        as abap.dec(11,4)) 
      as zfi_e_kdv_tutari) as kdv_tutari,
      rbkp.waers
}
where
      rbkp.vgart != 'RS'
  and rbkp.stblg =  ''


In Turkish the field label in the table after I run SE16N query was missing:

But now I translated the data element in English and logged in with English and now it's showing:

Field Labels are entered in both languages:

Edit2: After I entered the English translation to the data element to show you the error, I logged back in Turkish again and now it's working in Turkish too. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

entry.title: Restrict accessible migration projects in 'Migrate your data' application/ LTMOM tcode

Can you please suggest the Authorization object which restrict the accessibility of projects in the app/tcode?

entry.title: Van stock visibility without using storage locations
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We currently have our service technician vans represented as storage locations on our ERP, but as we have hundreds of service technicians, this causes a big maintenance effort in terms of customizing due to the usual changes happening with the technicians (new hirings, resignations, change of address, etc).

Does anyone has experience with other solutions (in S/4 or even other SAP products) which could be used to represent the service technician vans and still allow us to have the visibility we have today of the stock existing on each van?

 

Thanks,

Nuno

entry.title: Joint Venture Company in SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are using SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023, to implement Joint Venture (JV) company setup, I would like your guidance on the best approach for configuration.

Scenario:

The JV company operates under a parent organization, but we need to maintain separate financial reporting for the JV, including:
⦁ Trial Balance report (specific to the JV)
⦁ Tax declaration report (for statutory filing)
⦁ Access restricted to JV-related plants, project, masters...

Operationally, we want to segregate transactions, assets, and costs.

Constraints:

We cannot proceed with creating a separate Company Code for each JV because there will be multiple Joint Ventures in the future.
I would like to handle the configuration internally (as the client) without engaging an SAP Partner.

Questions:

Can we achieve this by creating a separate Segment and Plant within the same Company Code?
Will this configuration allow us to generate separate Trial Balance and Tax Declaration reports for each JV entity?
What is the recommended approach for data authorization and access control, so that only JV users can access JV-related data?
Are there any best practices or SAP Notes available for such JV setup scenarios?

Objective:

We need your segregation of financials, reporting, and data authorization for the JV company while maintaining integration with the parent organization where necessary.
Any advice, configuration guidance, or reference documentation would be highly appreciated.

Thanks & Regards,
Silambarasan R

entry.title: What’s the value of C_TS422_2504 and how do you pass it?
entry.content:
Hey everyone,

I’ve been looking into SAP certifications and came across C_TS422_2504 (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition – Production Planning & Manufacturing Associate) SAP Learning+1. It seems targeted at folks who want to validate skills in manufacturing planning under S/4HANA Cloud Private.

I’m curious:

  • What’s this certification really worth in the job market (especially in manufacturing / supply chain roles)?
  • How do people who passed it recommend preparing — best study materials, practice exams, hands-on experience, etc.?

entry.title: Drilldown and Navigate to in multi dimensional report of custom analytical queries
entry.content:
Hello Team,

On S/4 Hana private cloud, I have a requirement to create custom analytical queries as end user and be able to add new navigations on my queries and remove few standard navigations coming via standard semantics of added fields.

Is it possible to do so? Can we change the order of navigations shown in custom analytical queries - standard navigations displayed?
Can we remove the one not needed and can we add new for new custom field (if added)?

Also, is it possible to get link on line item shown in the table view of multi dimesional report?

Best Regards,
Malika Bathla.

entry.title: Batch-specific UoM Proportion/product unit of measure GON invalid for item 000010 Message No. VL382
entry.content:
I've a scenario where I have a finished product managed by a Batch-specific UoM with type: Product Unit, and I am facing this error message when I try to make a delivery with the Alternative UoM (Product Unit) Reference to a Sales order with the Base UoM
"The sales Unit (Also the Base UoM) in the sales order is "KG" and the Alternative/required UoM in the Outbound delivery is "GON" 

"GON" UoM is a custom UoM created equivalent to the UoM: "BAG"

Note: this scenario has been tested in MM by creating a PO with UoM: "KG" and MIGO GR by UoM: "GON" and it's working properly

The error message:

Proportion/product unit of measure GON invalid for item 000010

Message No. VL382

entry.title: supplier evaluation with scheduling agreements with no ending date (ending date 9999), possible?
entry.content:
When you make a supplier evaluation with scheduling agreements with no ending date (ending date 9999), does the system include them in the evaluation? In ECC is not possible, as the system only includes scheduling agreements with ending date (closed, and not the ones with 9999 as ending date).

Thanks!

Is there any standard configuration settings available to restrict to perform TECO and Business Closure when there is open PO ? Please shed some light on this .

Thanking you 

Best Regards

entry.title: Invoice Print Type - IDOC vs Form (Fragmented Forms)
entry.content:
Hello Gurus,

I'm looking for some inspiration and war stories from you talented people.
Are we the only ones struggeling with the Print Type settings in the pricing procedure when controlling output in the our Adobe Forms as well as INVOIC IDOC?

Background: In our pricing procedure we're using Print Type to control both line item pricing display on the form as well as determine value in IDOC Segment E1EDP26 (INVOIC02). Business wants these two outpu to differ in certain countries - E.g. Form to show a set of pricing, while IDOC typically containing more.

We have tried: Changing the content of the form directly, supressing values from the Print Type setting, leaving a mismatch between Print Type and actual print. However, using the same form across multiple countries, following method significantly increases complexity.

Have any of you successfully managed to separate the Print Type setting for the form content from IDOC content? Any advice on how to implement the split?

Appreciate you time,
Best regards,
Aske

SAP S/4HANA SD (Sales and Distribution)

entry.title: What’s New in Subscription Order Management 2025 FPS00
entry.content:
New Release

PUBLIC

  October 2025

We’re thrilled to announce that, effective October 8th, 2025, the Subscription Order Management (SOM) 2025 FPS00 release is now generally available for our customers.

This release brings a comprehensive suite of new advanced functionalities, enhancements in mass processing applications, improved user experience, along with an expanded integration capability designed to empower your business in a rapidly evolving subscription economy.

Let's dive into these latest product features in detail.

Subscription with Recurring Delivery of Physical Products

Imagine Elite Printing Solutions, a growing printer company that offers a Printer-as-a-Service model to its customers. Under this subscription model, the company provides high-end printers bundled with a recurring supply of toner cartridges, standard printing paper, and other essentials, all delivered directly to the customer’s premises or offices. Customers prefer such subscription-based models as they eliminate operational overhead and remove the need for upfront investment or ownership of premium-priced printers.

Traditionally, it has been challenging to manage such hybrid subscription scenarios, where physical devices and consumables are delivered at regular intervals. Businesses have often had to manually trigger and track deliveries and ensure accurate billing. Moreover, handling adjustments, such as adding new flavors or increasing ordered quantities to match the growing consumption, had also increased the complexity. These manual efforts frequently led to operational inefficiencies, billing errors, and missed opportunities to scale adaptive subscription models.

Figure 1: Illustration of the Coffee Subscription Use Case

 

 

Do you see similar business scenarios in your industry? Now, imagine extending this subscription-based recurring model which includes periodic delivery of physical items extending to other sectors. Imagine in fashion retail, you can receive curated boxes of clothing or accessories at regular intervals, industrial consumables having periodic replenishment of tools, safety gear, or machine parts, vending machines-as-a-service, or even medical and healthcare equipment (e.g., dialysis machines, infusion pumps) or consumables (e.g., syringes, test kits) requiring regular replenishment.

Thanks to the new Recurring Delivery Subscription feature in SOM, these challenges can now be managed seamlessly as part of the out of the box solution. You can now easily design and manage subscription models that cater to businesses across diverse industries and sectors.

Figure 2: Recurring Sales Item and Delivery Plan

Benefits:

  • Offer unified subscription experiences by bundling products, services, and recurring deliveries into a single, seamless subscription model.
  • Out of the box standard scheduling of replenishments with subscription to reduce manual effort and errors.
  • Enhance customer satisfaction with consistent, on-time delivery of essential products and services.
  • Enable flexible growth by allowing easy adjustments to delivery frequency, product mix, and subscription tiers as customer needs evolve.

Constraints:

  • In the current release, it is not possible to create a subscription order or a solution quotation with a recurring sales item using an API. It can only be done from the UI.
  • Recurring sales items are not visible in the Manage Subscription Contract Lifecycle Fiori app. That is, if you open a subscription contract with a recurring sales item in the Manage Subscription Contract Lifecycle Fiori app, the recurring sales items won't be visible in the contract hierarchy.
  • These features are on our product roadmap and are already planned for upcoming releases.

 For more information about this new feature, refer to Subscription with Recurring Delivery of Physical Products topic on the SAP Help Portal.

Target Quantity for Subscriptions in Master agreement

Have you ever faced a situation where an enterprise customer orders 100 units but requests delivery of only 30 upfront, with the rest spread out over the year? Managing such partial deliveries becomes even more complex when special pricing or discounts are configured in the master agreements. Without proper tracking, businesses often struggle to monitor how much of the committed quantity has already been delivered and how much remains, leading to billing errors, disputes, or missed revenue opportunities.

Let’s consider a scenario where, a healthcare equipment provider offers ultrasound machines on a subscription basis to hospitals. A hospital signs a multi-year subscription with a special pricing agreement in the master agreement for 10 devices. However, the hospital intends to have a phased rollout (delivery) across departments rather than taking all machines at once.

  • As part the initial deployment, the hospital plans a partial shipment of 4 ultrasound machines.
  • In the second shipment, the hospital requests 5 more machines as their expansion continues.
  • In the final shipment, the hospital installs the remaining 1 machine to complete the plan

 

 

Target quantity

Released quantity

Remaining quantity

Master agreement 

10 EA

0

10 EA

Initial shipment, subscription order 

 

4 EA

6 EA

Second shipment, new subscription order

 

5 EA

1 EA

Final shipment, new subscription order

 

1 EA

0 EA

 

Figure 3: Target quantity in Master Agreement

With the new Target Quantity feature in SAP Subscription Order Management (SOM), such scenarios are now easy to be managed out-of-the -box.

  • Businesses can define a target quantity for a subscription product directly in the master agreement.
  • Call-Off transactions (orders or solution quotations) can be created until the total released quantity reaches the defined target.
  • Each time a new call-off is created, the system automatically checks the cumulative ordered quantity against the target quantity.
  • If the new request will exceed the agreed limit, the system prevents over-ordering, ensuring compliance with the contract terms.
  • The target quantity remains flexible and editable even after the master agreement is released, allowing businesses to adjust as their needs evolve.

For more information about this new feature, refer to Creating Call Offs with Reference to Master Agreements on the SAP Help Portal.

Best Practice Content (Scope Item 7WB)
Subscription Order Management: Master data and basic functions

As part of this new release, we’re excited to introduce SAP Best Practice Content (7WB). This scope item is a curated, pre-configured library of recommendable business processes, master data, configurations, and test scripts tailored for Subscription Order Management. This content will help our customers and partners to jump-start implementations with industry-aligned standards, reduce configuration effort, and leverage proven patterns rather than building everything from scratch.

We are further enhancing this scope item to include all critical business processes — and these enhancements are already part of our roadmap, so stay tuned!

The following capabilities are included with this release:

  • Create organizational structure and master data setup required for the creation of a subscription order.
  • Create a subscription order with the Internal Sales Representative role using subscription products including a multilevel advanced variant configuration BOM.
  • Transfer of a subscription contract to the follow-up system (such as SAP Convergent Invoicing) through the Order Distribution I­­nterface (ODI).
  • Replication will trigger the creation of a billing plan and generation of recurring and one-time charge billable items (BITs) for the subscription contract, as configured in SAP Convergent Invoicing.
  • In Convergent Invoicing, trigger the billing and invoicing of the billable items.
  • Display the new subscription contract details on the Subscription Contract Lifecycle Management Fiori app.

For more information about this new scope item, refer to New Scope Item for Subscription Order Management - 7WB on the SAP Help Portal.

Other Enhancements

In addition to the features mentioned above, Subscription Order Management 2025 FPS00 also introduces the following enhancements:

Rerating of Shared Allowances

Shared allowances have been a part of SOM since the SAP S/4HANA 1909 FPS01 release. However, until now, the process of re-rating shared allowances wasn’t supported. With this release, we’ve now enabled the re-rating of subscriptions contracts with shared allowances.

You can now perform end-to-end re-rating in both Convergent Invoicing (CI) and SAP Convergent Charging (SAP CC). To ensure accuracy, the entire sharing group is re-rated together when a re-rating is triggered, which means that all contracts linked to that group are automatically recalculated to ensure accuracy and consistency across the board.

Prerequisites:

  • Only the same business partner is allowed for all contracts within a sharing group; but account split is possible.
  • Only a single contributor contract (contract that creates a shared allowance) is supported within a sharing group.

 

Navigation from Fiori to Entitlement Management (EMS)

We have further enhanced the integration and user experience between SAP Subscription Order Management (SOM) and SAP Entitlement Management (EMS).

Users can now seamlessly navigate from the Fiori apps for Subscription Contract Lifecycle Management (F6193, F6487) directly to the related EMS Entitlement.

From the Fiori ‘Open In’ menu, simply select ‘Display Entitlements’ — this action will open the corresponding EMS document in a new browser tab, providing a smooth and integrated user experience across the BRIM and EMS landscape.

Figure 4: Fiori Navigation to related EMS entitlement

Improvements in Mass Processing Apps

In the SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS0 release, we introduced the Mass Changes of Subscription Contracts and Manage Mass Change Processing Fiori apps.

With the SAP S/4HANA 2025 FPS00 release, the mass processing apps are now even more powerful, flexible, and efficient. You may find more details about the initial release of these Fiori apps in our blog, What's New in Subscription Order Management 2023 FPS00.

Here’s a quick look at some of the key enhancements and new capabilities introduced in this release:

Improvements – Fiori App Mass Changes of Subscriptions F7405

Extended selection limits – The Mass Changes of Subscriptions app allows you to choose all the subscription contracts that you want to change and take them over into a mass processing. However, there were certain restrictions from Fiori for the number of contracts that can be selected. Based on the feedback from our customers, we extended the app to enable a larger number of contract selection in a single selection and you can also add these contracts in a single mass processing.

 

Improvements – Fiori App Manage Mass Processing of Subscription F7406

  • You can now select and schedule a mass processing directly from the search screen, allowing you to trigger multiple mass processing runs simultaneously.

Figure 5 Improvements in Fiori App Manage Mass Processing of Subscription F7406

 

  • Number of Total Requests in a List Report – You can now view the number of items contained in a mass processing. You can even set a filter on this calculated key figure, to identify mass processing runs based on their size.

Figure 6 Improvements – view number of total requests in the Fiori App Manage Mass Processing of Subscription F7406

Other notable improvements are:

  • A new change process for updating the CCM version
  • Improved UX with an enhanced header section that showcases a more comprehensive KPI structure and a new processing status for background processing.
  • The mass processing run has been transferred to the Background Processing Framework (bgPF) for an improved transactional consistency and control, stability and asynchronous execution.

For more information about this new feature, refer to App Details: Mass Changes of Subscriptions on the SAP Help Portal.

More Information

Subscription Order Management 2025 FPS00 has been released to customers on October 8th, 2025. For more information about Subscription Order Management 2025 FPS00, check out the following links:

  • What's New in SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 FPS00 (Go to Finance > Billing and Revenue Innovation Management > Subscription Order Management)
  • Product Assistance on the SAP Help Portal
  • Integration Guide: Integration Guide for S/4HANA BRIM using SOM
  • Business AI in BRIM: Joule Help Page     Initial Setup of Joule for BRIM
  • Questions and Answers for Subscription Order Management in SAP Community
  • SAP BRIM Customer Influence Portal > Opportunity area “Solution Quotation and BRIM”

entry.title: Do standard business events exist for SAP PPM (Project and Portfolio Management)?
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I would like to know if standard business events are available for SAP PPM (Project and Portfolio Management), specifically for Portfolio Item Decision Point status changes?  None seem to be listed in SAP Business Accelerator Hub, nor are any listed in the PPM Help Documentation.

The use case involves triggering an SAP Build Process Automation Workflow via Event Mesh, when the status of a Portfolio Item Decision Point is changed.

In the absence of a standard business event, what is the recommended approach for creating a custom event for this scenario?:

  1. Use SAP NetWeaver Add-On for Event Enablement; or

  2. Use a RAP Business Event.  The issue I see with this approach is that we would need to create a custom RAP Business Event for a standard business object (Portfolio Item Decision Point),  when a corresponding RAP Business Object does not seem to exist.  Creating a Derived Business Event is also not an option because there is no standard Business Event to reference.   

Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,
Mustafa.
